intro: Diplycosia morobeensis var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the Morobe ovate-leaved diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
